abstract: The cooperation and assistance of industrialized nations and the United Nations and its agencies in promoting the transfer of remote sensing technology in developing nations was discussed. Training programs, workshops, and seminars as well as on-going globally scattered demonstration projects were evaluated and it was suggested that emphasis should shift from centralized training to scheduled regional training programs, resulting in larger local participation and on-the-spot application of the technology to solve local problems.
title: The transfer of remote sensing technology in the developing nations:  An observation

publications.publicationName: ERIM  Proc. of the 11th Intern. Symp. on Remote Sensing of Environment, Vol. 1
